newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly molasses report - May 12.
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly molasses report - May 12.

text.p: Prices on sugarcane were mostly steady in the week ended May 12 except for Houston which was steady to $2.50 higher, USDA Market News said.
Molasses supplies were moderate with light demand, with domestic molasses usage remaining light due to slow feed sales and increased grazing in the Southern U.S., it said.

Additionally, lower milk prices pressured molasses sales in the Upper Mississippi River region. Feed Molasses (minimum 79.5 brix, 43% sugars, except where noted) wholesale prices, tank car or truck, fob terminal, prompt delivery, dollars/ton, 1/
Type/ Market Area As of Noon: Last Week Last Year

1/ Per ton prices are based on 171 gallons for blackstrap molasses. To compute cents per gallon prices on cane molasses divide dollars per ton by 171 gallons ($ per ton divided by 171 gallons = cents per gallon). Ton - 2,000 lbs; Gallon= U.S. gallon.
**Prices represent sales fob terminal to the general feed trade in the respective areas but do not necessarily reflect sales to other trade areas.**
* Includes the major Uppper Mississippi river tributaries with the exception of the Missouri River.
Source: USDA-Illinois Dept of Ag Market News Springfield, Il. 217-782-4925.
